head.title: G.M. South Africa Gets a New Name

hedline.hl1: G.M. South Africa Gets a New Name

block.p: LEAD: The local company that is acquiring the General Motors Corporation's South African assets said it would change its name to the Delta Motor Corporation from General Motors South Africa Ltd. G.M. officially pulled out of South Africa on Jan. 1, citing a slowing economy and the slow pace of reform for the nation's apartheid system of racial segregation.

The local company that is acquiring the General Motors Corporation's South African assets said it would change its name to the Delta Motor Corporation from General Motors South Africa Ltd. G.M. officially pulled out of South Africa on Jan. 1, citing a slowing economy and the slow pace of reform for the nation's apartheid system of racial segregation.
Delta also said it would not sign the Sullivan Principles, a set of guidelines on labor practices for American companies in South Africa.

George Stegmann, personnel director of Delta, said, ''Like many other South African companies, we will continue to apply progressive and nondiscriminatory employment practices and exercise social responsibility in the community we serve.'' COMPANY NEWS
